Reviews.Title: “Good value, tucked away on a back street by the Nieuwe Kerk.”
Reviews.Author: RonTSmithers_B_C_
Reviews.Content: Quiet location in a busy area (near Dam Square). Easy walk from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: DJR249
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just off one of the main roads leading from the Central Station. 10 minute walk from CS and around the corner from Dam Square. Very convenient. Breakfast was included and was more than sufficient. Rooms are sparse, but if you don't expect extravagance, you will probably be satisfied. Housekeeping leaves something to be desires. We were there for 7 nights, they may have vacuumed the room 1 time. And all the rooms were dusty. Other than dust though, bathroom was clean. This hotel was a very good value as accommodations in Amsterdam are very over-priced as a rule.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousEssex
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel. The room was spacious and clean, the bathroom was well appointed. The rooms had tea/coffee making facilities - albeit a bit limited with plastic cups! The hotel reception staff were helpful and the buffet breakfast was very nice with plenty of choice. The hotel is in a very convenient location - short walk from central station and close to all the sights.I would definitely recommend for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for this quite nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AlisonWombourne
Reviews.Content: Clean, basic hotel, nice tidy room and comfortable beds. Shower a bit slow but it got you clean. Breakfast was just continental and got the day started. Not much of a view (other buildings) from the hotel bedroom. But it was warm and had a good working TV with quite a choice of languages (including BBC1) What the hotel lacked in it's luxury, it certainly made up for in it's excellent location right in the heart of Amsterdam. It was a 10-15 minute walk from the Centraal Station (don't go by taxi, they charged us 15 euros then an extra 5 on top for "our luggage!") Plenty of eating establishments nearby. Yes we had a most enjoyable Easter Break.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: 4apa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for two night. It takes 10 minutes to go in the hotel by walk. The street is small and there are a lot of people but they did not make a noise. Staff was helpful. There is tea maker in the room. Wi-fi internet was good. Room was clear, bed is comfortable. Bathroom is good and clean. Breakfast was modest, but not bad. Minus: hotel took 50 euro guarantee fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gempodge
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a real gem, it is very clean and great value and best of all only a few yards for Dam Square in the Heart of Amsterdam.Staff were also very friendly and made its a very pleasant stay.Only a 5 to 10 min walk from Central Station which links you to the Airport. Would defo recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: PDXfrequenttraveler
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Dam Square Inn in downtown Amsterdam is nicely located within walking distance to the Main Train Station and with train access to points around the city and close access to canal cruises, shopping streets. The reception staff are always helpful and nearby are a number of good restaurants and pubs. Check out the all-you-can-eat Sushi restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Sweet”
Reviews.Author: RSan70
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right in the center of city just 5 minutes walking from city rail station connecting Airport and Europe. Tram connections, Canal cruise, shopping street, restaurants, Tour departures too were very close. Staff was very helpful and kind. The room was very small, but our overall stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: Caitlin H
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam on 2 January so the streets of Amsterdam were filthy! There was litter everywhere! We walked from the Central Station to the hotel (about 2.5kms) not bad and instructions on how to get there worked, but when we arrived in our street we were shocked that that was where we had to walkled down - quite dodgey! Once found the hotel wasn't as bad as the rest of its surroundings. The rooms are quite old fashioned and carpets are dated. There were two single beds pushed together - which I hate (hardly romantic!) and no curtains - it was winter and the sun only rose at 9h30 but still it made the room cold and unfriendly. Towels were the size of my bath mats at home and could hardly wrapped around me. The buffet breakfast was just cereal, youghurt and toast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: tinylass
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night in the hotel during a mini cruise from Hull to Amsterdam so we chose it mainly for the location as we were only staying for 2 days. Being just around the corner from Dam, it was within easy walking distance of just about everything and being a very flat city, you can do LOTS of walking! The hotel itself was extremely nice and exceptionally clean. The staff were very welcoming and friendly and spoke very good English. The rooms were quite large with a great big comfy bed which made it even better for us being as the tiny single beds on the ferry across were not that great! The rooms had everything in them you could need including a flat screen tv, tea and coffee making facilities, a safe and shower gel and shampoo in the bathroom. The breakfast was nice but didnt have as much choice as other hotels i have stayed in, including other Best Westerns. Overall this was a great choice of hotel and i highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Norman C
Reviews.Content: We often use Best Western hotels, this one is not up to the usual standard. Friendly and helpfull staff made an otherwise poor hotel just acceptable. Continental buffet breakfast is good with excellent service, but note there is no actual restaurant in the hotel - breakfast only. Very small bar in reception area. It is in an excellent location right next to the 'new church' (the cathedral at Dam Square) and good for sightseeing, restaurants, catching trams etc. Our room was rather cramped, the lighting was so dim it was next to impossible to read books, maps etc. The view out of the window was of a damp and mouldy 'light well'. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom (supplied with kettle, coffee etc) was spacious and clean. Potentially a nice hotel but in need of some rennovation. We are getting on a bit and had been warned (by email after booking) that the lift was temporarily out of use, the hotel reservations staff had 'guarenteed' us a room on the 1st floor - we did not get it and had to climb many stairs with our baggage - not nice. Be warned that there is no direct vehicle access to the hotel. Our taxi (50 euros from the airport) dropped us at the end of the road and we had to walk the last 80 meters or so in the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: redjockey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid December for 2 nights, it is a very central hotel less than a minutes walk from Dam Square. Hotel was very clean and our room was good, with bath/shower and tea/coffee making facilities. Breakfast was ok. The ladies on reception were very pleasant and helpful. Of the many other hotels we have stayed in in Amsterdam, this is by far the nicest for the money. About 15 minutes walk from Centraal Station. Will definitely be back again soon. Note, the lift is currently being updated, so you have to use the stairs (not steep and not many), but should all be fixed by the New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: viajero_chica
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Best Western for the weekend in November. The service we received was excellent, very helpful and friendly receptionists. The rooms were clean very nice and lots of space considering majority of hotels in Amsterdam can be a bit poky. The hotel on a little street off dam square so you are away from all the noise but still accessible to everywhere. Plus there is a pizza shop and a lovely little bakery right across from the hotel, and a couple of coffeshops for those that require them. If I go back to Amsterdam I wouldnt hesitate to go back to this hotel, I really couldnt fault it!

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 location, poor room”
Reviews.Author: MojcaV
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel for 2 nights on end of September. Hotel is on gr8, peacefull location, only a few steps from Dam Square and first shopping street. Hotel staff was friendly and helpfull (we rent bikes for 24 hours). Brakfast was O.K.- continental, enaugh healty food. Room was clean and realy old poor decoration in it. Coz the weather was just fantastic, we didnÂ´t spend more time in room as necessarily. Othervise it will be very inconvenient. But the bakery a cross the street was very pleasant, with good coffee and mint-tea :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler32
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location - friendly staff and great breakfast. We will be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Not Bad on Price”
Reviews.Author: ukkylie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night at the beginning of September on our bi-annual family trip. The hotel is within short walking distance of most things you would want or need in Amsterdam. Yes, it is tucked a way in a small alley, however so are most of the great places to visit in Amsterdam. If you have a map with you, you can locate the hotel with the greatest of ease. The rooms were exactly what you would expect from a Best Western - clean, comfortable and generic. This was ideal as we got exactly what we were expecting. Though I can't recall if there is air conditioning, sorry, we stayed in another 15 or so hotels after this one! There were 3 adults in the room - the single bed folds down out of the wall. The room had tea and coffee facilities, a safe, free wifi, standard TV stations (including BBC1) as well as a clean bathroom with a decent sized shower (certainly a plus in Europe!!) and there is a bar in the lobby, though we didn't take advantage of it while we were there. We arrived early and stowed our luggage (they were more than happy to do this), though we did have to wait a while as there is only 1 front desk person to deal with almost everything! The lady who checked us in was extremely helpful with directions, maps, transportation and other questions we asked. She also recommended a variety of places to eat dinner that evening. Yes, the hotel is a little spendy, but then again, so are most hotels in Europe - and this hotel is right in the center of beautiful Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RossLyon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, the location is very good on Gravenstraat, plenty of shops, restaurants around the Hotel, within 5 minutes of Dam Square and the major Shopping streets. Anne Frank Huis is also only 10 minutes walk away. The hotel was very busy, with only one person at the front reception it was sometimes difficult to get service, the rooms were okay, a little tired very basic features.Bag Storage is available if you arrive early like we did on a Sunday morning. We had a street view room which was great, but tended to be a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: yknizhnik
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on Sept 11 as a follow-up to our river cruise and were very happy with the choice. For some reason, it was very hard to get a room in Amsterdam for that particular day: many places were fully booked and the ones available were _extremely_ overpriced, so finding this hotel for 175 euros was a bargain, believe it or not! Both, the room and bathroom were clean and of decent size, though the decor's a bit outdated. The bed was not great but certainy OK. We were actually quite happy we didn't get a street view since this whole immediate vicinity around Dam Square has many bars & restaurants where partying goes on late through the night. A breakfast was very good, and the only staff person we dealt with was extremely nice and helpful. Walk to the train station in the morning with all suitecases (to go to the aiport) took only 12-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: radulr
Reviews.Content: It is very well placed for exploring the city, right in the middle of everything. Supermarkets nearby, restaurants, attractions plus the charm of the old streets. The hotel is comfortable but it is nice if you get a street view, otherwise the room will be dark. Breakfast is decent. Beds are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: carol a
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dam square inn on the 29th of August for a two day break. Hotel was in a great location, but very expensive considering the standard of the hotel. The rooms were ok bit tired on the decor, breakfast quite poor, staff not very friendly, had an incredibly noisy pair of men opposite our room one night which was quite scary with shouting and led to a very poor nights sleep, had to ring reception but not much could be done. Wouldn't stay here again simply due to the cost.

Reviews.Title: “We hated this place!”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor23_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a wonderful hotel for five nights in Amsterdam (the Amrath) and then went on a cruise. After the cruise we had one more night in Amsterdam and stayed at this hotel. It was awful! The person at the front desk was rude and unhelpful. She said we had no chance of an earlier check in, and when we asked her for a scale to weigh our luggage she would not let us take the scale to our room. The room was awful - it looked dirty. The curtains looked as if someone had used them to wipe up mud. The towels were small,thin and dirty looking and when we asked for more towels (we needed four for the next morning) we were told that we could only get three towels. Someone had left a wet dirty towel on the desk in our room. The beds were uncomfortable and so were the pillows. The carpets in the hallways and on the stairs looked filthy.This hotel needs a complete overhaul. To be fair though, the guy in the breakfast room was pleasant and friendly, but I asked for some lemon slices and he said they didn't have any. I would absolutely NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good First Night"”
Reviews.Author: TLK11
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Best Western Dam Square Inn for one night. We arrived on a warm, summer day after a long flight. The air conditioned rooms were cool, comfortable, clean, and quiet. We had two rooms located near each other. The hotel is located on a quiet street in a very busy neighborhood. We found the location to be convenient and safe. We enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel. It was a good first night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JP1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and was pretty happy with my choice. As others have said, the location is great. It is steps away from Dam Square, which is convenient to everything. However it is tucked away just a bit on a side street away from the crowds. The room was decent size and clean. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Free breakfast with room was just ok. My one complaint was the walls were very thin.. I could hear everything in rooms next door and outside the hotel. Got a little noisy at time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chaoswarriorx
Reviews.Content: I travel to Amsterdam several times a year on business, and this is the only place I will stay. It's not so much that is magical, the rooms are nice but nothing special, but the internet is fast if not cheap, and the staff is simply amazing. I know them all by name now, and there are always super friendly and helpful and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: First and foremost the location is convenient to restaurants and cafÃ©s,etc Easy walk from Central Station about 10 minutes to the hotel and Dam Square area. There is a restaurant a few steps from the front door. Entrance is located in an alley, there is a large sign you canâ€™t miss it. There is a red door which is unusual but adds a touch of color. Room was clean, bed comfortable, room normal size for European hotel ( small by US standards), TV, hot water maker for tea and instant coffee(small cups). Internet is about $12.98US for 24 hours. The lady at the front desk the night before we left was kind enough to print our boarding pass. Check in is at 2p; we were not allowed to check in until very close to 2p; we arrived about 9:30a so we changed clothes and went out to explore area, check out is at 11a. Breakfast consist of coffee chesses, meats and pastries. There is not a restaurant on premises, but there is a small breakfast area. Staff was courteous. I would stay here again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: SaliB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel when it was a Golden Tulip, a few years ago, and quite enjoyed it. Location is really good being right beside Dam Square and easy to reach restaurants, pubs, cafes and shopping streets. We only stayed one night on this trip, and it was ok. The room was clean, bed fairly comfortable. Breakfast left a lot to be desired and it was the first hotel wanting us to pay for internet after a 2 week, 6 hotel tour of Holland and Austria. I would not recommend this hotel to family or friends, or go again myself, but if you are looking for a reasonably priced, clean place to stay that is central then this one will do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: holly1985
Reviews.Content: Postives: This hotel is very close to the station (we walked it in 10mins). The hotel itself is hidden down a little side street (very quaint) and this actually proved to be a good sound break from Dam Square (just around the corner). There are lots of places to eat and have a drink at nearby. Make sure you go to Pasta a basta it's a great italian and the waiters sing! Simon Cowell should visit there as they are brilliant-little stars in hiding! We found the hotel staff to be lovely-they called aorund restaurants and made bookings for us and recommended places to visit and dine at. Negatives: The rooms were a little dingy and the window looked out onto an airshaft. I would definately book this hotel again-it's a great base and you aren't even in the room that much-get out and explore Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: ayvdm
Reviews.Content: The location is the best in Amsterdam. It is near everything!! TIt is near the trams, busses, supermarket, Dam Square which is very lively and there is a lot happening. Great restaurants just outside the hotel entrance. We were lucky to get a suite in the hotel, comlimentary. The staff were great, very friendly and helpful. The only negative is that free wifi were advertised but when we got there they charged for 7 Euro a day for wifi....

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ArnaldoKF
Reviews.Content: If you want to do everything on a walking distance in Amsterdam, this is a great hotel. Rooms are clean, it seems safe and mostly all the employees are friendly. Breakfast was includded, no hot dishes, continental style, that could be improved. Wifi was available, but charged and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Really looked me and my girls”
Reviews.Author: Dexxxe
Reviews.Content: Went for a birthday trip in march 2011. The staff were friendly, helpful and catered to all our request. We would all recommend to friends and family and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carla_Tanaka
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel! Great location.. my room was comfortable and quiet. Staff was nice and breakfast was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - But pay by cash only :(”
Reviews.Author: Maddyfunk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good and neat. Location good too. In amsterdam most of the locations are good, I could walk around the city and come back to the hotel--had breakfast... wide spread.. sweet n simple but a bit expensive, given the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: chukarhead
Reviews.Content: Our room was quiet, clean, and no smaller than most reasonably priced rooms I've stayed at in Europe. The location allowed us to walk everywhere from the train station to the museums. Breakfast was included and consisted of bread, sliced meat, cheese, orange juice, grapefruit juice, milk, a few kinds of cereal, yogurt, coffee and tea. There is a nice brasserie across the street. The main negative point for me was that most of the places nearby for eating leaned towards fast food. A great location for shopping. And there is an Albert Heijn grocery store a couple of blocks away next to the Magna Plaza where there is a wide selection of cheese to try or buy.

Reviews.Title: “it was alright for us...”
Reviews.Author: marwa87
Reviews.Content: when we first arrived it was very hard to find, we cruised around asking people but at the end we were happy with its location, very convenient location close to tram station, dam square, many shops and restaurants around,,this was what we wanted! a central location, we didn't care much about the room, bed was comfortable and toilet was clean. we mainly wanted to discover amsterdam and we knew we would only go back to the hotel for sleeping. the breakfast didn't have much to offer it def needs improvement. i don't think i would recommend this hotel to family and friends, but maybe for young people who just want to go and discover the city and not pay much to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings & a Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: MyZiggyMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend between trips to The Hague and Germany. The hotel was hard to find. It's in an alley behind a church on Dam Square, and there are no signs on the main streets to point you in the right direction. Once we found it, we had mixed feelings. The proximity to Dam Square, the main train station, and the tram lines was excellent. The location in the alley was a little weird since it's right across from a "coffeeshop" and there was always a steady stream of young people smoking pot in the street outside the shop. The hotel is in an old building, and the atmosphere inside is a little run down. We booked a room for two people weeks before the trip, but at check-in were told that a single room for one person was reserved. They were able to accomodate us and give us a room for two, but it was irritating. We booked, confirmed and re-confirmed but it was still wrong. The room was tiny with 2 twins smushed together. The only window was mounted near the ceiling and we had to use a stick with a hook to open or close it. The bathroom was half the size of my closet at home. There was a shower, but it was so tiny you could hardly turn around in it. I'll be honest. Our first impression was that it was a dump. On closer inspection, however, the room was indeed clean and the mattresses were incredibly comfortable. After the initial shock wore off, we were determined to make the best of it, especially since it was only for 3 nights. If you're looking for a certain level of European charm or space, this is not the hotel for you. But if you're looking for a clean room with comfortable bed near Dam Square and you aren't turned off by something on the lines of a private hostel room, you'll be happy here. The staff was friendly and helpful, and for that we were thankful. I can't say that I'd recommend this hotel to friends or family, but I would recommend it to young people looking to stay near Dam Square and the train station who don't plan to spend much time in their room and aren't hung up on luxury or amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet, Safe, Clean, Reasonable Price - Now Best Western”
Reviews.Author: DileepB
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights there and have no complaints. The staff was very helpful. Good breakfast. The Airport shuttle bus drops you off at the end of the alley. The pick up point is at Van Cleef hotel. Very convenient location near Dam Square. Short walk from Central Station. The rooms are somewhat small but comfortable. Entire hotel is non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,good value,clean & friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui1823
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel & found it to be in an ideal,quiet location off Dam Square.Staff were friendly,polite & helpful at all times.I stayed in rm 228 which overlooks the lane at the front of the hotel.Windows are only single glazed so there are associated sounds from the lane but no traffic passes through.I believe rooms to the rear of the hotel are quieter.My rm was serviced everyday of my stay.It was a good size with plenty of rm to comfortably move around ,there was a hanging wardrobe,safe, en suite shower rm,very comfy bed & radiator.There is a lift to all floors,breakfast was continental,3 types of cereal,fruit,toast,yoghurt,rolls,meats & cheese,tea coffee & fruit juice.All in all a very enjoyable stay,would definately stay again & wouldn't hesitate to recommend to family & friends.Ps.I consider myself to have high standards!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tyljam5
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to Amsterdam and we hit it lucky when we booked this hotel. Its in a perfect central location just off Dam Square. We were in a room overlooking the alley way and were happy with our room and the breakfast. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, would have expected a better standard both from room and staff”
Reviews.Author: janbananOslo
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, but not the rest. The staff was not specially friendly, they hardly looked at us. The room was small, but OK. They did not have any room with extra beds so 3 persons could not stay in one room. We also had an accident with a cup of instant coffee-powder on the floor. When we came back, the room was'nt cleaned, and the reception called to our room and said they would not clean it until we payed 10 euros extra because of the powder. Was'nt they supposed to vacuum-clean the floor anyway? Why take extra charge, it was no extra work to sweep the vacuum cleaner over the powder, it would have taken the staff maybe 5-6 seconds extra! They did not refill the minibar the 3 days we were there either. I would not recommend this hotel to other persons, because it's very expensive, has an average standard and a cheapskate and not friendly personell that hardly look at you or say hello.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quite hotel in perfectly central location”
Reviews.Author: jean0815
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in very central location in Amsterdam. Just around the corner from Dam Square behind Nieuwe Kerk this hotel has the perfect location to both explore the city and access any other location around the city center. Rooms are ok and the service is too. Lively surroundings but quite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong with it”
Reviews.Author: EJF212
Reviews.Content: This is a well located hotel that doesn't suffer too much from the noise and bustle around but it's a bit overpriced for what it offers. It wouldn't have been my first choice in Amsterdam - I was booking at very short notice and there were few other convenient options. I had a room up on the third floor directly under the roof - the air con was essential as it was unusually steamy in Amsterdam and it was perfectly effective. The room was basic and ready for an upgrade but was clean as was the bathroom. The staff were friendly. Essentially there's nothing particularly wrong with this place but nothing in particular that stands out positively about it either.

Reviews.Title: “THE ONLY GOOD POINT ABOUT THIS HOTEL WAS THE LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Jacko64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in desparate need for refurbishment. We were allocated room 222. Beds spongy bathroom just ok. Towels virtually transparent and the worst hospitality tray I have ever seen! Room only serviced once during a 3 day stay! No offer by staff to assist with small luggage and for what we paid I would have expected a lot more attention to detail. Location was very good but that's about all!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for an average hotel, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: NorthWalesTrekker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this very average hotel for one night, great location but definately not worth the money we paid (Â£140). Breakfast was continental (not the best), room was clean but with several niggling problems that we would have reported on a longer stay. The hotel did let us store our bags before and after booking in, that was very helpful given our flight times

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good 3 star”
Reviews.Author: raj037
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent four nights at the Tulip Inn. The location was excellent for easy access to public transit and for interesting walks. In spite of a carnival in nearby Dam Square our room was quiet and comfortable. The breakfast was quite adequate, if not, inspiring. However, housekeeping left something to be desired in that the shelves in the closet were quite dusty and the bathroom, on one day at least, had not been cleaned. We found the various staff at the reception desk to be very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Phylomela
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in center, very good for sightseeing. However, only pedestrian areas surround it, no cars, no trains, no any noise. But I should say that walls are thin and if you have active neighbours - so possibly you may hear their chatting or TV-set. One night we had such problem but receptionist solved everything in a polite manner. Breakfast was included (I'm not sure - was it special offer or usual terms) - good choice of food and quality of service. The only one drawback that I noticed was about room cleanliness... It was a little bit dusty in it, I mean the dust on any surfaces: on table, on shelves, on lamp ect. But bed linen and towels were clean. Just in front of entrance we found very small cafe with fantastic pastry :-) Finally we are satisfied with Tulip Inn, next time we'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mandyryan
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in the Tulip Inn Amsterdam and what a weekend it was! The hotel is just around the corner from Dam Square and about a 10 minute walk from the red light district so excellent location. There is a coffee shop straight across the street so very handy indeed!! The room we stayed in was clean but basic. The heat was unbearable in the room so the window had to stay open all night but that was a minor problem.Slept great all 3 nights ,no noise from the street or other rooms so that was a big bonus. Breakfast was a let down,very basic . We would 100% stay in the Tulip Inn again for the location over everything else!!

Reviews.Title: “Very central, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: WanderingAngeus
Reviews.Content: The location is as central as one needs to be in the city. Situated on a pedestrianised street with a couple of bars, coffee shops & several nice restaurants. The hotel is a well run no nonsense typical 3* affair. Everything was as it should be.The room was a reasonable size & spotless. Plasma TV with lots of channels. We got a deal on three nights which made things well worth it. Breakfast was good (self service) but finished at 10.30, a bit strict to my mind if you are relying on city break tourists. Staff were efficient & friendly. As for the bad review two down, all I can wonder is had he spent too much time in a coffee shop?? Utter rubbish, don't be put off. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: debbie27CoKerry
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a good one to stay in been bac 3 times now have stayed somewere else but this was better value everything is on ur doorstep brill and as far as the bed bugs go wot a load of cods wollop!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: yorkie1973
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel for a one night stop in Amsterdam, and I came across this by chance. Not knowing Amsterdam at all, the location looked fairly central to me, so I plumped for it. It's located only about 500m from the main train station (although you need keep both eyes open when you cross the road from the station), just off one of the main shopping streets. There is a tram stop a couple of minutes walk from the hotel, so you are afforded good transport links to the rest of the city. The street has a couple of a cafes and a couple of bars on it, but you aren't disturbed by noise from the street. We were up on the 3rd floor, and a restricted view of the Nieuw Kirke, but hey, we could just step out of the hotel to see it! The 3rd floor was readily accessible, even for a pushchair, with a good sized lift. The staff were very helpful, and we were able to leave our bags in the Concierge's room (which was locked) both before check-in and after check-out The breakfast was fine, with a good selection of cereal, fruit, yoghurt, meat and cheese. All in all, I couldn't fault the hotel, although it's walk-in room rate is 175 Euros, which is a little high. There do seem to be many deals available for here, and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, spotless and central.”
Reviews.Author: AthensSoloist
Reviews.Content: After 5 visits to the city, at last I found a hotel I would happily stay in again. Very reasonably priced (for Amsterdam standards), it offers central location (just off Dam Square) and high quality accommodation. Our room was spacious, the bathroom was spotless with new equipment. Tea/coffee making stuff is available, beds are very comfortable and bedsheets are of high quality. Wireless internet costs 7 euros a day. The breakfast is good and the selection is satisfactory, but there is no hot food available (e.g. scrambled eggs). Reception staff is helpful and polite. Only bad surprise was the housekeeping: we found our windows in the room left wide open (thank God it had been raining for only 10mins, otherwise the carpet would have been soaked), which is unacceptable for safety reasons as well. The beds were not really made, the bed cover was just thrown on the bed, and the maid had not even straightened the pillows, and nightwear was not folded. As we only stayed for 2 nights, we don't know whether this was an isolated incident or the standard housekeeping procedure, however it kind of ruins the very good impression of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location-comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: tamarara65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three fun filled days in Amsterdam. The Tulip Dam Square was the perfect setting. Just a few blocks from dam-square and walking distance to the red-light district. The hotel is nestled on a cozy litlle block with lots of character. A few doors down is a very popular pub and right accross the street from a coffee shop.--also a beatiful old church was the view from our window. Basically everything was right there. The room was very modern. It looked as if it were recently updated. The bed was very comfortable. The only complaint is that the shower stall (no bathtub) was very small. A large person would have a tough time in there, I think. Breakfast was included in the rate and consisted of breads, hard boiled eggs, yogurt and juices and coffee. A hearty breakfast can be had at the corner cafe. Make a right out of the hotel and go to the main road-it's right there. I had a DELICIOUS banana pancake-nice omelettes etc too. I would definitely stay here again, as it was clean, comfortable and in a good location. Try to get a room facing the street. It was a really nice view-although we did here noise from the pub on a Saturday night. But who goes to Amsterdam for peace and quiet, right?

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Starting Point”
Reviews.Author: globies
Reviews.Content: So, the hotel is situated perfectly in a very central area of Amsterdam. Super-close to major must-see tourist site and situated right in between the nice high-end area of the city and the notorious coffee shop district. The hotel: From the outside, it looks very nice and it's surrounded by a few nice outdoor cafes that are great in the summer. Not sure about winter months. Inside, it's what you would expect from a chain hotel of this class (think Comfort Inn but smaller and a little aged). The rooms were small and the hotel is. It's acceptable. Much better breakfast than we expected. Now, I'm a real hotelie. I have stayed in great places and I know what to expect from a hotel. In this case, I wanted a base and to save money. Manage expectations. If you want a decent place and base, go for it. If you want a hotel experience or a cool boutique hotel, look somewhere else. Some other good options are a little closer to the park. You really don't need to be in the middle of it all. You can always be near the park and museums. But it's Europe, so manage your quality expectations!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lolacola23
Reviews.Content: We really struck it lucky with this place. We just booked a standard double room, but upon our arrival at the hotel, they had 'unfortunately' made a mistake with the booking and had no double rooms left, and had to put us up in the Bootz Suite, which is the best room in the hotel (it even has its own button on the lift) The room had a huge seperate bedroom with the comfiest bed ever, a spacious bathroom , and a seperate living area with cable TV Excellent! Plus, we couldn't have asked for more in terms of location, everything was right on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Aussieabroad007
Reviews.Content: The friendly, helpful desk staff who welcomed us on arrival gave us a good first impression of the hotel and of Amsterdam in general. Our room was quite big, with a very comfortable bed and a view of the lively little street outside. The hotel had recently been completely redecorated, so everything looked very clean and fresh. The continental breakfast offered plenty of options and the wait staff were very attentive. The area (just off Dam Square) has lots of good restaurants, cafes, bars, coffeshops, etc. nearby. Many tourist attractions are within easy walking distance, and the tram service is excellent, with tram stops close to the hotel. The hotel staff provided safe storage of our luggage the day we were leaving, and when we came back to collect our gear they ordered the taxi for us, and provided cold drinks (free) . One disadvantage of being in a room at the front of the hotel was the late night street noise of people down below, so light sleepers would be well advised to ask for rooms at the back. Our only complaint was the dimness of the lights - no good for anyone who likes to read in bed. But the big new tv with plenty of English speaking channels was some compensation for this.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, central hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: shibby
Reviews.Content: I was a bit wary of staying here after looking a some of the reviews but decided to go ahead as the location was so good.On arrival discovered that the hotel renovations were just finishing and it had been redecorated. The bedrooms were clean and quiet with flat screen tvs and very comfortable beds and the bathrooms looked new. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good. I was very pleased with the value for money particularly as I had a single room. I would definitely stay here again. The only minus point was the room wasn't cleaned very well during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “tTULIP HOTEL GREAT”
Reviews.Author: gillygilly
Reviews.Content: Just come back from having 2 nights at The Tulip Hotel Dam Square and it is a lovely hotel .Very clean ..In a very good position and we had a very nice room.The only down side is that we went to early to check in and they made us wait as they don't let anyone check in before 2 PM . it's understandable if the room is not ready but when it is ready I don't see why they can't let you check in whatever the time . Breakfast was continental but very good . Plenty of choices for you . No need to go hungry . Bought a package of trips which was very good value .27-50 euros The Hop on Hop off boat is an excellant way of getting around . As the flight back was not till 7-30 on our last day we did the Country Side Tour 9-30 til 2-30 .Volendam and Marken are certainly worth seeing . Very picturesque. You can leave your bags at the hotel if you don't want to carry them around with you or you can leave them at the office of the Tour Company . A good tip for visiting the Anne Frank house is to buy your ticket at the Tourist Information Office near Central Station .It is 50 cents more but you choose the time you want to go in and then you just walk straight in when you get there instead of having to queue.All in all a very good trip

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vjcc80
Reviews.Content: Me and my Fiance have just been to Amsterdam for 3 days. We stayed at The Tulip Inn dam Square. For a 3 star its a great choice. The rooms are lovely, with lots of space, a really nice bathroom and great views of the city. To see that people have said it's in need of decoration was quite surprising as we didn't think this at all. Breakfast was really nice with lots of choice and the location was excellent within 30 seconds walk from Dam Square/the red light district/cafes etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “depends on what you want”
Reviews.Author: pieszynski
Reviews.Content: the rooms aint big and yes the hotel does need redecorating quite badly BUT, the beds are comfy, the hotel is quiet and the bathrooms are brand new and very nice. As a place to rest up between cafes and bars its a winner, as a destination hotel . . . that would be a resounding no. Also fantastic staff well used to helping dazed and confused tourists!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: 53BLOSSOM
Reviews.Content: If you are the trpe of person put off by a bit of decor then accept what the last review said. If however, you can see past a bit of decor and are looking for a hotel which is in an excellent location, has amazing staff and a lovely breakfast then this hotel is for you. The reception and breakfast area are immaculate and well decorated and yes it is true that the rooms could do with some new wall paper but I guess this only matters if you plan on staying in your room watching tv rather than out seeing this fantastic city. The room was exceptionally clean and the bathroom immaculate (looked new). The staff were extremely helpful, friendly and spoke amazing English. This hotel is located about 30 seconds walk from Dam Square, 8 minutes to the train station and 30 seconds from main shops (including a supermarket about 2 minutes away). In terms of price I thought this was very competitive at Â£116 per night in the middle of May and could not get such a great located hotel for such a price elsewhere in Amsterdam (I tried!)

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing, shabby”
Reviews.Author: IrelandVacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Tulip Inn recently we were not impressed we found the entire Hotel needed redecoration, the paintwork was very shabby the carpets were very stained leading from the reception area to the lift, which put you off before you even got to the bedrooms. The rooms were very small and basic certainly not worth the prices we were being charged,I checked other Hotels in the area which were far superior and very little difference in the cost.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: familyr4
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 1 night. it took us ages to pick a good location and hotel but we finally pick this one. we have stayed with the company before last year in bussey saint george France and could not fault them hence going again in Amsterdam. we got there early and the room was not ready til 2 but they let us unload our bags into the store room which left us free to roam and sight see. they informed us that the double bedroom was not big enough to put an extra bed in for our 8yr old but had put us in the triple for the same price as the double. once in the room it did smell of smoke but with Holland not having a no smoking policy i did expect it but we opened the window and went out while the air blew threw. the beds were good and comfy the room was clean the location was excellent for us with our 8yr for walking to and eating could not of picked a better location. the breakfast was plentiful and eat as much as you want. once again as we had to be out of the room by 11 and not getting collected until 5 they let us put our bags in the store room til we needed them. all in all i would recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: BOBSAWAY
Reviews.Content: Great location just off Dam Square in a nice little lane. Hotel is clean and comfortable and is what you would expect from a 3 star hotel. Nothing special about the rooms or facilities. However this hotel scores very high on value for money, exceptionallly helpful staff and good breakfast. We paid 79 euros for a double room including a nice breakfast. Now if you are expecting bacon.eggs and blackpudding then you will be disaoppointed but if you like fresh breads. cold meats, cheeses, fresh fruit and cereal washed down by good coffee and fresh juice then you will enjoy it. Staff very helpful and efficient. Room was quiet and spacious although bathroom was small but very modern and clean. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Shaz E
Reviews.Content: Myself and two girlfriends stayed at The Tulip Inn Dam Square for 3 nights in November, thanks once again to the positive reviews on Tripadvisor I booked a lovely hotel which was central to everything in Amsterdam, just what we required. Arriving at Schipol airport we came through arrivals and walked straight to the railway station just follow the signs, to take the train to Amsterdam Central, really easy, trains run every 20 mins, you get your tickets from a yellow ticket machine (3 euros and 60 cents one way) then the train journey takes about 15 mins. When you exit the railway station be aware of the trams and of course the bicycles which are everywhere. We walked from the station to the hotel which took about 10 to 15 mins with cases, just head to Dam Square, the hotel is easy to find. On arrival we were checked in really quickly by nice staff and then shown to the lift to take us to the floor our room was on. I had requested a quiet room on a high floor with 3 single beds and this was just what we got. The room was clean and of a good size with heating and duvets on the extra long beds rather than sheets, there was coffee making facilities, tv and a nice size bathroom with a walk in corner shower and soft towels, there was also a hairdryer. This is the cleanest bathroom i have seen in any hotel i have stayed in. The room rate included breakfast in the lovely breakfast room which was never busy but always had plenty of food on offer, you had a choice of tea or coffee which was brought to your table, you then served yourself to cereals, fruit juices, cold meats, cheeses, yogurts,rolls, toast and fresh fruit, a great leisurely start to the day without feeling you had to rush. There was also a bar in the foyer of the hotel, not that we used it as there is so many bars to choose from just outside the hotel especially St Pauls bar and restaurant which is 2 doors away from the hotel, very relaxed atmosphere with nice food. The other bar and restaurant i must recommend is one we found close to the red light district called Het Karbeel in a street called Warmoesstratt, an excellent find with attentive staff and a wonderful menu, we ate here two evenings out of the three we were in Amsterdam. The cheese fondue was mouth watering as a starter and the king prawn was too die for. Both nights we spent over four hours eating our meal, nothing was rushed and we felt totally relaxed, the glass of Port at the end of the meal was the icing on the cake. This was a great city break, nice hotel in a central location just what you need without having to spend a fortune. I couldn't fault the hotel at all and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: youngnewlywedNewry
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. it was a fantastic hotel and great value for money. The hotel is right in the centre of the town and situated beside dam square and the dam rak. The room we stayed in was massive with your own tea and coffee facilities. The room and hotel were spotless. The staff were so friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a selection of breads, hams, cheese, fruit or cereals. I would advise everyone looking for a perfect hotel right in the centre of amsterdam to book this one.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tyroLisbon
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this tulip hotel for 6 nights. In Amsterdam hotels often charge more than they are worth so i chose this hotel mostly based on tripadvisor reviews. I wanted to stay near Damrack so location was perfect. The hotel didnt disapoint me. I was relieved when we arrived and entered a nice lobby with a bar and a nice reception, everything ok. Also, we arrived at 1pm and the room was already ready for us.Clean room, nice bed, small tv with remote but tv wasnt really important, there is a phone with answering machine, window to the front street but we didnt hear noise at night or morning because its a quiet street, nice bathroom with window to the front street too, a nice shower but water pressure was a bit weak, they offered coffee and tea and we could make them in the room. there is an elevator, the corridors are also clean.For breakfast they had diferent types of bread, corn flakes, boiled eggs, youghurt, coffee, tea, cheese, etc.. but it could be a lot better. Dont expect a big breakfast. Staff was nice, all of them. i noticed that some of the rooms didnt have a window facing the front street, but they had a window facing an inside terrace instead, wich wasnt ok for me. if i had stayed in one of those rooms i would probably be complaining here, instead of saying that as long as you get a room similar to the one we got, you will be happy. Its not expensive by amsterdam standards, you pay but its safe, and the location is great, so it justifies the difference in price to similar hotels with not so good locations. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: R0b0c0p
Reviews.Content: We had two night break in late May 07 in Amsterdam, we stayed at the Tulip Inn Dam Square. If you are like my wife and myself who looks for a clean, well run hotel situated in the heart of the city, this is the hotel for you. For a 3* hotel it far surpassed our expectations, the rooms were fairly large with a beutiful bathroom and plenty wardrobe space, air condition and t.v. ask for a room at the back of the hotel if you require total peace and quiet. The breakfast which was included in the price was continental style, the variety was exceptional and the staff were very attentive. The reception staff were very helpful and assisted us with all our enquiries about getting around the city and places to go. The only downside to this hotel is that one of the lanes that leads to the hotel has a fair bit of graffiti on the walls, we were not put off by this but i thought it might be worth a mention. This hotel could not be better situated, you are within walking distance of most of the main sites and shops. Unless you are a tourist who finds faults in everything you will not be disappointed with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Central, good standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bathsheba
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at this hotel. Modern "chain" hotel design, behind an old facade, so without the character of some Amsterdam hotels. However, the staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast good, bed comfortable, and the hotel itself very quiet, although only two minutes from Dam Square. (I would point out that there are two Tulip Hotels in Amsterdam - possibly more - make sure you know which one you've chosen!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: spelpa
Reviews.Content: Last time i went to Amsterdam i stayed into the worst hotel i stayed in my life. So this time i checked very carefully the reviews and the photos and i decided to stay in Tulip Inn Dam Square. What a perfect little hotel. I was happily surprised. Very, very clean. Towels changed every day. Large twin room. Long & comfortable bed. Breakfast was good. The location is also excellent . Its close to everything. Next time i'll be in Amsterdam I'm staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rosielola
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for a short break - you are right on Dam Square but the hotel was very quiet - we couldn't hear any noise at night. Breakfast was good - plenty of it! There tends to be a lingering smoke smell around but that seems to the norm in Amsterdam. Rooms were clean and staff were extremely helpful. Don't drink in the bar though as the prices were high - plenty of bars/cafes nearby. Would definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: countryqueen
Reviews.Content: went to the city for a few nights as a suprise for my boyfriend, couldnt find a hotel that was very central and quite reasonable in price, as a travel agent myself i took great care in choosing the right hotel. If you require a luxury hotel, its not for you, but this hotels location is hard to beat. The rooms are fine, clean and tidy, if your going on a city break you tend not to laze around your hotel! The breakfast was continental, so we opted to get our breakfast elsewhere, like little bakerys which we had a fresh bread, jambons, coffee, criosants etc. lovely! great hotel for exploring the city and nice and quite, on a quaint little cobbled street. hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: AoifeMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tulip Inn Dam Square for one night in November. It is in a perfect location right smack in the middle of Amsterdam. The staff were efficent and friendly and the rooms were clean and pleasant. If you are plannig a tshort break this is an ideal place to stay. Overall was very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location that is all”
Reviews.Author: Sparkes
Reviews.Content: Location is excellect. Hotel itself was fairly grim. Very dated. Rooms feel like a portcabin. Bathrooms fine...must of been done recently. Staff not all that helpful in recommending anywhere to eat. Great little belgian bar about 4 doors up. Pair of mens shoes left in my friends room.....little off putting to say the least. We only stayed one night and although location was great wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great find! Friendly, helpful and courteous staff. Hotel was in an excellent position for all the sights and the shops. Buffet breakfast was ideal and set you up for the day. Our flight was cancelled so we arrived early the next morning. They gave us a room quickly although my two friends had to wait 40 mins for a non-smoking room but they didn't charge us for the no-show night. Would recommend this hotel highly for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: interested82
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from excellent trip to Amsterdam. Went to Tulip Inn after recommendation from a friend. Agree with other reviews about the hotel, corridors need a new carpet and a touch of paint.Bedroom was quite small but very clean, there was no view, but going in January this did not matter. Breakfast was good and served until 10.30 which was good if you had been out late the night before. The best thing about the hotel was the location. Within easy walking distance of train station (can leave bags at hotel on arrival), Anne Frank museum, Dam Square, shops and red light district. Tram stops very near the hotel. The belgian beer bar up the steet is good but best is the small pub next to the hotel althiugh it does shut at 8.30pm. You need to go early evening before going to the many excellent restraunts, always walk in the direction of the Anne Frank museum rather then the shops for the best eating places. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerinTEXAS
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Amsterdam from the U.S. I highly recommend this hotel for its location and service. The room is small but very clean and quiet. The center of town and all tourist spots are literally a bus ride away. All staff speak English. The room is quaint, and ask for the third floor as you have a "sky light " that cranks open and closed. I like the small atmosphere and loved the little bar and b. fast area. This is one you will return to and find a value and many more positives than negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: G&JV
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal for the heart of the City. It is a small hotel and the rooms are very basic. reasonable continental breakfast. Time of checkout is 11am. Cleaners knocking on door at 10:45!! This city has lots of hotel choices, so one can afford to be a little picky. I wouldn't rush to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chosen at Random And a Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Noticeably clean. Good choice at breakfast. If we ever visit Amsterdam again - hopefully we will - then we wouldn't hesitate in using this hotel again. Very, very convenient location as well. Great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: traveltortoise
Reviews.Content: one of the best highly recommended, especially the breaakfst. lovely and quiet too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very centrally on a quiet street. We had a big room equipped with all standard facilities. Everything was clean. Nice breakfast. We enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “a place where you feel like family”
Reviews.Author: pleasure
Reviews.Content: this was my second stay at the tulip inn dam sq and i would return. comfortable clean rooms friendly staff great breakfast. i wish they would have cleaner rugs in the halls and make the halls less dreary they have as much charm as a hospital. but the location , the staff again breakfast buffet and kindness and personal care will bring me back to a sweet little connor of amsterdam.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Dam Square Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 12-16 Gravenstraat, Amsterdam 1012 NM, The Netherlands
